urlText: T1 Western Line: Trackwork may affect your travel
content:
Saturday 24 and Sunday 25 July
  • Trains run between Emu Plains or Penrith and the City to a changed timetable.
  • Richmond trains run to a changed timetable between Richmond and Olympic Park. If you are travelling to or from the City please change at Parramatta to continue your journey.
  • On Sunday from 5.50am until 11am, buses replace trains between Richmond and Blacktown.
  • Trains run between Blacktown and Leppington only, stopping all stations between Parramatta and Leppington.
  • Some trains continue to run between Blacktown and Schofields.
  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date information.
Bus routes
30T1 Richmond, then all stations to Schofields and return
50T1 Richmond, then all stations to Blacktown and return
57T1 Schofields, then all stations to Blacktown and return
subtitle: T1 Western Line: Trackwork may affect your travel

properties.speechText:
Saturday 24th and Sunday 25th July

Trains run between Emu Plains or Penrith and the City to a changed timetable.
Richmond trains run to a changed timetable between Richmond and Olympic Park. If you are travelling to or from the City please change at Parramatta to continue your journey.
On Sunday from 5 50 A M  until 11 A M buses replace trains between Richmond and Blacktown.
Trains run between Blacktown and Leppington only, stopping all stations between Parramatta and Leppington.
Some trains continue to run between Blacktown and Schofields.

urlText: Melbourne to Sydney XPT alteration.
content:
Due to border closure The 18:50 and 07:30 Melbourne to Sydney XPT services will commence at Albury. No travel service will be provided between Melbourne and Albury.


Use the Trip Planner for the latest travel information with real time updates.
subtitle: Melbourne to Sydney XPT alteration.

urlText: Trackwork on other lines may affect your travel
content:
Saturday 31 July and Sunday 1 August
  • No trackwork scheduled on the metro, but trackwork on the City Circle may affect how you travel.
  • T1 North Shore Line trains run between Berowra and Wynyard, and T9 Northern Line trains run between Hornsby and Central only.
  • You may need to change at Wynyard or Central to continue your journey.
  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date information.
subtitle: Trackwork on other lines may affect your travel

urlText: City Circle: Trackwork may affect your travel
content:
Monday 26 July
  • From 10pm until 11.50pm, trains run to a changed timetable in one direction only, from Central first stop Museum.
  • From 11.50pm until 1.30am, trains run to a changed timetable in one direction only, from Central first stop Town Hall.
  • Some City Circle trains run to a changed timetable and leave from different platforms. 
  • Some trains start or end at Central. You may need to change trains to continue your journey. 
  • The light rail runs between Central, Town Hall, Wynyard and Circular Quay. 
  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date information.
subtitle: City Circle: Trackwork may affect your travel

urlText: City Circle: Trackwork between Central and Circular Quay via Museum may affect your travel
content:
Tuesday 27 to Thursday 29 July
  • Nightly from 10.10pm until 1.30am, buses replace trains between Central and Circular Quay via Museum. 
  • Trains continue to stop at Central, Town Hall and Wynyard. Some trains start and end at Central. 
  • If you are travelling to: 
    • Museum or St James, change at Central for a bus 
    • Circular Quay, change at Wynyard for the light rail or Central for a bus 
  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date information. 
Bus route
5CC: Central, Museum, St James, Circular Quay and return

urlText: City Circle: Trains will not run
content:
Saturday 31 July and Sunday 1 August
  • City Circle trains will not run.
  • Buses replace trains between Central and Circular Quay via Museum.
  • The light rail runs between Central, Town Hall, Wynyard and Circular Quay.
  • T4 Eastern Suburbs & Illawarra Line trains continue to stop at Central, Town Hall and Martin Place.
  • If you are travelling to:
    • Town Hall, catch a T4 Eastern Suburbs Line train or the light rail
    • Wynyard, catch the light rail
    • Circular Quay, catch the light rail or a bus
    • Museum or St James, catch a bus
  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date information.
Bus route
5CC: Central, Museum, St James, Circular Quay and return
subtitle: City Circle: Trains will not run

urlText: T1 North Shore Line: Trackwork may affect your travel
content:
Saturday 31 July and Sunday 1 August
  • Trains run between Berowra and Wynyard only due to City Circle trackwork.
  • A shuttle train service also runs between Lindfield and North Sydney.
  • Buses replace City Circle trains between Circular Quay and Central via St James.
  • The light rail runs between Circular Quay, Wynyard, Town Hall and Central.
  • T1 Western and T9 Northern Line trains start and end at Central, platforms 1-12.
  • From 11pm Saturday until 5am Sunday, buses replace all trains between Central and Strathfield.
  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date information.
Bus route
40T2: Strathfield, then express to Central and return (Saturday night / Sunday morning only)
subtitle: T1 North Shore Line: Trackwork may affect your travel

urlText: T1 Western Line: Trackwork may affect your travel
content:
Saturday 31 July and Sunday 1 August
  • Penrith trains run to a changed timetable between Emu Plains or Penrith and Central, platforms 1-12 only.
  • Richmond trains run between Richmond and Olympic Park only. If you are travelling to or from the City please change trains at Parramatta.
  • T1 North Shore Line trains run between Wynyard and Berowra only.
  • Trackwork on the City Circle may also affect how you travel.
  • If you are travelling to:
    • Town Hall, catch a T4 Eastern Suburbs Line train or the light rail
    • Wynyard, catch the light rail
    • Circular Quay, catch the light rail or a bus
    • Museum or St James, catch a bus
  • From 11pm Saturday until 5am Sunday, trains run to a changed timetable between Emu Plains or Penrith and Ashfield only, making extra stops at Flemington and Homebush. Buses replace all trains between Ashfield and Central.
  • If you are travelling to the City change at Lidcombe for trains via Bankstown, or change at Strathfield for express buses to Central.
  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date information.
Bus routes
45T2: Ashfield, Summer Hill, then express to Newtown, Macdonaldtown, then Central and return
46T2: Ashfield, all stations to Central and return
50T2: Lewisham, Petersham, Stanmore, then express to Central and return
40T2: Strathfield, then express to Central and return (Saturday night / Sunday morning only)
subtitle: T1 Western Line: Trackwork may affect your travel

urlText: Trackwork between Ashfield and Central
content:
Saturday 31 July and Sunday 1 August
  • Buses replace trains between Ashfield and Central.
  • Leppington trains run between Leppington and Ashfield only, making extra stops at all stations between Homebush and Ashfield.
  • Express and limited stop trains continue to run between Strathfield and Central.
  • Change at Strathfield for express trains to Central.
  • Change at Ashfield for all-stations buses between Ashfield and Central.
  • Trackwork on the City Circle may also affect how you travel.
  • From 11pm Saturday until 5am Sunday, buses replace all trains between Strathfield or Ashfield and Central.
  • If you are travelling to the City change at Lidcombe for trains via Bankstown or change at Strathfield for a bus.
  • Express buses leave from Strathfield, and all-stations buses leave from Ashfield.
  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date information.
Bus routes
50T2: Lewisham, then Petersham, Stanmore, Central and return
51T2: Ashfield, then Summer Hill, Newtown, Central and return
52T2: Ashfield, then all stations to Central (Bypass Macdonaldtown) and return
55T2: Macdonaldtown, then Redfern and return Saturday night / Sunday morning
45T2: Ashfield, Summer Hill, then express to Newtown, Macdonaldtown, then Central and return
46T2: Ashfield, all stations to Central and return
50T2: Lewisham, Petersham, Stanmore, then express to Central and return
40T2: Strathfield, then express to Central and return (Saturday night / Sunday morning only)
subtitle: Trackwork between Ashfield and Central

properties.speechText:
Saturday 31 July and Sunday 1 August

Buses replace trains between Ashfield and Central.
Leppington trains run between Leppington and Ashfield only, making extra stops at all stations between Homebush and Ashfield.

urlText: Trackwork may affect your travel
content:
Saturday 31 July and Sunday 1 August
  • Trackwork on the City Circle, T3 Bankstown and T8 Airport & South lines may affect how you travel.
  • All Cronulla and some Waterfall trains make extra stops at St Peters and Erskineville.
  • Extra trains run between Hurstville and Bondi Junction.
  • Trackwork on the City Circle may also affect how you travel.
  • If you are travelling to:
    • Wynyard, catch the light rail from Central or Town Hall
    • Circular Quay, catch the light rail or a bus from Central
    • Museum or St James, catch a bus from Central
    • Stations between Green Square and Revesby, change at Wolli Creek
    • Stations between Revesby and Macarthur, change at Sydenham
  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date information.
subtitle: Trackwork may affect your travel

urlText: Trackwork between Lithgow and Penrith
content:
Monday 26 to Thursday 29 July
  • Nightly from 7.30pm until 11.30pm, buses replace trains from Lithgow to Penrith.
  • The last train from the Blue Mountains leaves Mount Victoria at 19:01, arriving Central at 21:23.
  • Tuesday to Friday, each morning, buses replace the 02:43 Mount Victoria to Central train from Mount Victoria to Penrith.
  • Nightly from 9.10pm until 3am, buses replace trains from Penrith to Lithgow.
  • The last train to the Blue Mountains leaves Central at 19:18, arriving Mount Victoria at 21:36.
  • Trains run to the normal timetable between Penrith and Central.
  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date information. 
Bus routes
7BM: Katoomba, then all stations to Lithgow and return
41BM: Penrith, then all stations to Katoomba and return
43BM: Penrith, Blaxland, Springwood, Katoomba, then all stations to Lithgow and return
46BM: Penrith, Blaxland, Springwood, Katoomba, then all stations to Mount Victoria and return
subtitle: Trackwork between Lithgow and Penrith

properties.speechText:
Monday 26th to Thursday 29th July

Nightly from 7 30 P M  until 11 30 P M  buses replace trains from Lithgow to Penrith.
The last train from the Blue Mountains leaves Mount Victoria at 19:01, arriving Central at 21:23.
Tuesday to Friday, each morning, buses replace the 02:43 Mount Victoria to Central train from Mount Victoria to Penrith.
Nightly from 9 10 P M  until 3 A M buses replace trains from Penrith to Lithgow.
The last train to the Blue Mountains leaves Central at 19:18, arriving Mount Victoria at 21:36.
Trains run to the normal timetable between Penrith and Central.

content:
Friday 30 July
  • From 8.10am until 3.20pm, buses replace trains between Port Kembla and Wollongong.
  • Trains continue to run between Kiama and the City to the normal timetable.
  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date information.
subtitle: Trackwork between Port Kembla and Wollongong

urlText: L2 Randwick Line and L3 Kingsford Line weekend closure
content:
From approximately 8pm Friday 23 July to 1am Monday 26 July, L2 Randwick Line and L3 Kingsford Line light rail services will not run, due to planned maintenance works.

From 8pm to 9pm on Friday 23 July, services will only run between Central Chalmers Street and Randwick or Juniors Kingsford. Use alternative transport between Central Chalmers Street and Circular Quay, including nearby trains or walk.

From 9pm Friday 23 July to 1am Monday 26 July, services will not run between Circular Quay and Randwick or Juniors Kingsford.

Use alternative transport as follows:
  • Trains or walking between Central Chalmers Street and Circular Quay.
  • Replacement buses between Central Chalmers Street and Randwick or Juniors Kingsford.
Replacement buses will run every 6 to 10 minutes, for more information on stop locations see the news article.

The L1 Dulwich Hill Line will continue to run as per normal schedule. Normal full light rail services will resume at 5am Monday 26 July.

Please allow extra travel time and use the Trip Planner or check travel alerts to see if you travel is affected.
subtitle: L2 Randwick Line and L3 Kingsford Line weekend closure

urlText: 07.08 Sydney to Casino XPT alteration.
content:
Due to preventative maintenance, this service will be a road coach for the entire journey. There will be no service to/from Dungog, Gloucester or Wingham.  


Use the Trip Planner for the latest travel information with real time updates.
subtitle: 07.08 Sydney to Casino XPT alteration.
